channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge finds Newsmax aired false and defamatory claims about voting-tech company
item.description: A Delaware judge finds the right-wing network aired false and defamatory statements about Dominion Voting Systems' role in the 2020 presidential elect...

item.title: 10 emerging writers win Whiting Awards
item.description: The awards, which come with a $50K purse, have helped launch the writing careers of many now well-known authors, including Colson Whitehead, Ocean Vuo...

item.title: LeBron James becomes first male athlete with a Ken doll
item.description: The doll also reflects the basketball star's height - it's an inch taller than the standard Ken doll.

item.title: Why Gabon's coup leader is bucking a trend by embracing democracy
item.description: Brice Clotaire Oligui Nguema swaps his uniform for a suit in a bid for electoral success.

item.title: 4/9: America Decides
item.description: Trump announced 90-day pause on new tariffs except China; Former Ohio Gov. Kasich on Trump and state of Republican party

item.title: H.R. McMaster receives accidental call from President Trump
item.description: Sources say former White House national security adviser H.R. McMaster was surprised to hear President Trump's voice on the phone.

item.title: Apr 9: CBS News 24/7, 4pm ET
item.description: Trump increases tariffs on China to 125% while pausing tariffs beyond 10% for other countries; '60 Minutes' finds 75% of migrants deported to El Salva...

item.title: 4/9: CBS Evening News
item.description: Stock market sees historic rally after Trump pauses reciprocal tariffs; Uber's most interesting lost and found items

item.title: Why Trump is hitting China on trade - and what might happen next
item.description: There is much more to this than straightforward retaliation, writes John Sudworth, and it traces back to his first term.

item.title: Trump steps back from cliff edge of all-out global trade war
item.description: The US is now making nice – or at least nicer - with nations that had faced their retaliatory trade fire, writes Anthony Zurcher.

item.title: War has changed Zelensky - but now is the time for him to transform again
item.description: How have the last three years shaped Ukraine's wartime president and where does he go from here?

item.title: What to know as Gayle King gears up for April space flight
item.description: Gayle King will step out of her comfort zone and into a space suit alongside Katy Perry, Lauren Sánchez, Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyen and Kerianne Flynn ...

item.title: Attorney representing a student protester detained by federal immigration agents
item.description: Amir Makled sat down with All Things Considered host Juana Summers to describe his experience and what it could mean for other attorneys who are going...

item.title: 20 musicians who should get to go to space before Katy Perry
item.description: On April 14, Blue Origin plans to launch a space flight with a crew that includes the singer behind the 2010 hit "Firework." But we can think of many ...

item.title: President Trump has announced a hold on most tariffs, but China faces tariffs of 125%
item.description: President Trump abruptly announced a 90-day pause on the steep tariffs that went into effect Wednesday -- except for China.

item.title: A California soccer coach charged in a 13-year-old’s death is accused of assaulting other teens
Hearing looks at rules for evidence and other details in Bryan Kohberger’s quadruple murder trial
Americans convicted in Congo of a botched coup attempt now face US charges
item.description: Three Americans repatriated to the United States from Congo have been charged by the U.S. Justice Department with staging an elaborate coup attempt ai...
